headline: London 2012 Olympic Games opening ceremony - in pictures
standfirst: Danny Boyle's spectacular vision took us from bucolic scenes to a moving dance version of Abide With Me, including dancing nurses, a parachuting Queen and Rowan Atkinson's version of Chariots of Fire

headline: Andy Murray wins Wimbledon with emphatic victory over Novak Djokovic
standfirst: Andy Murray won the men's singles at Wimbledon with a straight-sets victory over the world No1, Novak Djokovic

headline: Britain's first same-sex marriages take place as PM speaks of 'powerful message'
standfirst: Ceremonies take place in England and Wales as people take advantage of new law permitting same-sex marriages

headline: Hatton Garden heist: Eight charged over jewellery raid in London
standfirst: Men were arrested on suspicion of burglary from safety deposit box vault in capital’s diamond district on Easter weekend

headline: Theresa May to become new PM after Tory rival Leadsom withdraws
standfirst: New Conservative leader says she will ‘make a success’ of Brexit

headline: Quids in: why it’s time to get rid of your £1 coins
standfirst: The new 12-sided £1 coin arrives in March, and you will only have six months to offload the old ones. It’s also just 10 weeks until paper £5 notes are history

headline: England’s World Cup dream dashed as Croatia win semi-final in extra time
trailText: Croatia have crushed England’s World Cup dream with a 2-1 extra-time victory in their semi-final at the Luzhniki Stadium in Moscow

headline: Greggs launches vegan sausage roll
standfirst: UK’s largest bakery chain acts after petition called for vegan version of bestselling product

headline: Eat out to help out: Britons claim 35m discounted meals
standfirst: Treasury says figures released for first three weeks of restaurant scheme are expected to rise

headline: 'This is democracy's day': Biden sworn in as 46th president of the United States
standfirst: Millions watch inauguration from home as chief justice administers oath of office at Capitol, two weeks after mob riot

headline: Iceberg lettuce in blond wig outlasts Liz Truss
standfirst: Supermarket salad is crowned winner of bizarre competition that attracted global media attention

headline: Sweden wins Eurovision song contest in Liverpool with Loreen
standfirst: The UK was hosting the event on behalf of last year’s winner Ukraine and saw Loreen triumph with Tattoo

headline: Glasgow Willy Wonka experience called a ‘farce’ as tickets refunded
standfirst: Event billed as immersive ‘celebration of chocolate’ cancelled after children left in tears at sparsely decorated warehouse

headline: Chloe Kelly the hero again as England beat Spain in Euro 2025 final shootout
standfirst: Chloe Kelly struck the winning spot-kick as England retained their European crown by beating Spain 3-1 on penalties
